title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to one of the following.

· SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ has a larger, more polarizable electron cloud than SOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C55@ due to the greater number of electrons in Se MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGtbGaaeyzaaaa@37A3@ , leading to stronger London dispersion forces. Thus, the attractions between SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ molecules are stronger than those between SOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C55@ molecules, resulting in a higher melting point for SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ .

OR

· The bonds in SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ are more polar than those in SOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C55@ because the electronegativity difference between Se MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGtbGaaeyzaaaa@37A3@ and oxygen or fluorine is greater than that between S and oxygen or fluorine. Thus, the dipole-dipole attractions between SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ molecules are stronger than those between SOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C55@ molecules, resulting in a higher melting point for SeOF 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D3D@ .
